Experience Staff Software Engineer Technical Lead & Manager - Ads Google 2012  – Present (3 years) Greater Seattle Area Built a 10 person team which launched multiple big data analytics tools for Google display ads.  
 
## Responsibilities 
- Work with Product and Sales to identify and prioritize new projects 
- Work with Product to define project specific visions and roadmaps  
- Work with Product and Sales to iterate on specific feature requirements and development 
- High level designs for major system components, including presenting outside the team 
- Collaborate on detailed designs with members of eng team 
- Manage execution of major system components across eng team members 
- ~40% of time coding 
- Manage eng team’s career development and performance reviews 
- Grow team members into TL roles 
- Worked with recruiting to hire and pitch new team members  
 
## Projects  
Ad Performance Benchmarking 
Historical ad performance exploration, insights and competitive benchmarking tool. 
A frontend and backend which made it possible for sales users to drill down in real-time to relevant slices of previous two years of served GDN and TrueView ad performance data. For selected inventory users can see insights calling attention to low relative spend on ad products or answer questions such as “how are the people who engage with my client’s ads different than those who engage with their competitor’s ads?”.  
 
Campaign Performance Estimation 
Backend estimation system for Google Display Network campaign performance predictions. System is based on regression models built on historical ad performance. Serves estimates for Google sales team’s primary pitch planning tool. 
 
Budget Allocation 
Advertiser budget allocation recommendations across Google products and targeting based on relative conversion rates. 
 
## Other Activities 
- 160+ interviews conducted 
- Calibration + Promotion committees Software Engineer Technical Lead - Ads Google June 2009  –  2011  (2 years) Greater Seattle Area Identified new idea for helping Google sales teams improve their ability to sell keyword contextual targeted ads. The idea was a new way to allow users to easily mine historical data for display ads with semantically relevant kct targeting. Led a team of 5 in the design and implementation of resulting gwt frontend and mapreduce based data processing backend. 
 
## Responsibilities 
- Work with Product to define project specific visions and roadmaps  
- Detailed designs for major system components, including presenting outside the team 
- Manage execution of major system components across eng team members 
- ~75% of time coding

Summary I am a software engineer. I currently work on mobile and tablet apps, but I have done a lot of work on server side hosting and APIs. I am most happy as an Individual Contributor on a team building something cool, rather than taking on the role of planning, coordinating, or managing other people. 
 
I test the software that I build, I push back against unrealistic expectations, and I give thoughtful feedback on product design and features. That said, when a decision gets made, I execute it, even though I might not entirely agree with it. I am honest and direct, and can view feedback in the manner it was intended.

Experience Mobile App Search & Indexing - Engineering Manager, Tech Lead, Staff Software Engineer Google July 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Mountain View, CA Manage a team to index, understand, and serve the content in mobile apps. App Indexing for Google Search - Google Developers Edit Social Graph Service - Staff Software Engineer, Tech Lead Google January 2012  –  July 2014  (2 years 7 months) Mountain View, CA - The Social Graph Service provides a unified data model and API over all social graph data at Google. It is the central place for reading/writing membership data of G+ Circles, Hangout, G+ Communities, G+ Events and Google Voice, and reading user profiles. The service is a core component of several Google services including Google Plus, Hangout, and Google Voice. 
- As the Tech Lead of the Social Graph Core team, led a team of 5 engineers to develop the main system in Java on top of Spanner storage and ST index, and managed collaboration with clients to support new products and use cases. 
- Drove the design and implementation of the system for scalability (10+B user membership edges and 1M queries/second across 15 data centers), performance (under 12ms mean latency), consistency and client integration (70+ clients). 
- Personally wrote most of the system's backend serving layer and indexing solution. 
- Drove the migration of the system's storage from Megastore to Spanner, in the process significantly increasing the system's scalability (from 100 writes/seconds to 30+K writes/second) and consistency (full serializability). Completed the migration with zero system down-time or change to clients. 
- Led the launch of Hangout, G+ Communities and G+ Vanity URLs on Social Graph Service. Designed and implemented end-to-end indexing solution on top of ST index to support fast group chat lookup and various sorted views in Hangout client. Optimized the system's serving logic to reduce machine usage by 3X. View Google Play Music - Senior Software Engineer, Tech Lead, Architect Google November 2007  –  January 2012  (4 years 3 months) Mountain View, CA - The Metadata Management Service handles the storage, relationship management, retrieval, and matching of 30+M tracks and the associated metadata. It aggregates the artist, album and track metadata from hundreds of music labels, and manages the complex relationship in the data. It facilitates the matching of all ingested music content, and powers core functionalities such as music search, Scan-and-Match of user uploaded content, and recommendations. 
- Architected the system end-to-end. Personally wrote the first version of the system in C++ on top of Bigtable storage. 
- Engineered end-to-end metadata matching system that matches raw content from music labels and user uploads to existing music store records. The system supports the re-ingestion and matching of the entire music corpus in under a day, and instant update of newly ingested content in under 2 hours. 
 
- The Music Store Service powers the search and browsing experience in the Google Play music store, and is the central business server for music search results, purchase fulfillment, manually curated content, and customer reviews. It serves 20+K queries/second, 100+K orders and $300+K revenue per day. 
- Built the service in Java on top of ST index (search results), Zipit (reviews), and Checkout (orders). 
 
- Led a team of 6 to develop the frontend service in Java and client music player in JavaScript. Drove product features and designs with product managers and UI designers. (Open) 1 honor or award OC Award - Google Play Music For building and launching Google Play Music. View Web Suggest - Software Engineer III, Tech Lead Google September 2006  –  November 2007  (1 year 3 months) Mountain View, CA - Web Suggest is the feature that completes your query as you type in the search box. It started out as an experimental feature developed by 20% contributors. I was the first full-time engineer on the project. 
- As the Tech Lead of a 5-engineer team, productionized the system and graduated the product from experimental status. Drove the launch of the product in Asian markets (China, Taiwan, and Hong Kong). Achieved 25% feature adoption, increased average query length by 2%, and saved adopted users 48% keystrokes. 
- Using a Bayesian bigram model trained with query data in web logs, built the Chinese pinyin suggest feature that enabled Chinese users to input pinyin and get a list of matched Chinese character query completions. This greatly improved the search experience of Chinese users, allowing them to perform searches even when they do not have IME installed. Web Search - Software Engineer II Google October 2005  –  September 2006  (1 year) Mountain View, CA - Built using Python the Continuous Quality Evaluation Pipeline for CJK language segmenter to generate quality evaluation runs for quality experiments, and aggregate evaluation results. This enabled the evaluation, optimization, and ultimately the launch of Google's in-house CJK language segmenter that replaced the buggy and black-box third-party segmentation software we were using. 
- Implemented various web search frontend features including search query language encoding detection, and safesearch and results ranking twiddling for CJK queries. - At Epson, re-designed the printing algorithm of the Webprint client Windows application using Java, C++ and JNI, resulting in significant enhancements to application performance and printing quality. Designed and implemented printing app for Symbian OS using C++, Symbian SDK, and SPP. 
- At Redknee, built CTP (Card Telephony Protocol) Simulation System using Java and SQL. 
- At ATI (now AMD), developed 2D Graphics automation test suites using C++, GDI, Windows SDK, and Visual Test. Summary Life is short. I would be happy if I can develop into the best in one area. However my curiosity always propel me into uncomfortable territories. 
Since grad school, my focus has been building large scale Internet services. I am fortunate to have the opportunities to build/lead several application platforms, the largest of its kind, for google search, ads and shopping. Our systems are serving billions of users across the globe as well as empowering teams across the organization. 
My satisfaction comes from observing my visions become reality step by step. 
I will do just about anything necessary in order to ensure the project success, being it infrastructure, quality, production, or something else. Summary Life is short. I would be happy if I can develop into the best in one area. However my curiosity always propel me into uncomfortable territories.

Experience Staff Software Engineer, Tech Lead, Manager Google 2013  – Present (2 years) Kraków, Poland Lead a team of 8 engineers building a machine learning platform. Deployed as a collection of services behind a Web UI, the platform features model hosting, training, online and batch scoring, evaluation, and introspection, and supports binary­ and multi­classification models, and ranking models. The platform is used by several teams, and it is closely integrated with several production workflows. I have designed the system, and implemented one of the services (a training service). I have managed the project using Agile methods. I have lead collaborations with user and partner teams, in Mountain View and New York. 
 Staff Software Engineer, People Manager Google 2012  –  2013  (1 year) Kraków, Poland Managed an organization of 22 engineers, focused on advertiser acquisition. The org has built a range of tools and systems, from support systems used by Marketing & Sales, to prediction services, to handling promotional AdWords coupons. 
 
The latter is an externally­ facing service that handles redemption and fulfillment tracking of coupons, and it has been key in driving advertiser acquisition. I have co-­authored initial system designs, and later, managed the team in building and launching the system. I have coordinated integration of the system with Ads and Billing, negotiating timelines and driving between engineering, product, and business teams in Kraków and Mountain View.

Summary Software Engineer, with several years of experience of leading engineering team working on tough technical problems at Google-scale.  
 
I am a Software Engineer and Tech Lead/Manager, focusing on products for Google users with a personal touch; personalized products which scale to millions of users (Classic examples. include recommendations, collaborative filtering, related items and accessories, etc.). 
 
All of my engineering career has been at Google - I have worked in Search Quality, Shopping, Display Ads, Search Ads Quality, Android (Market, now called Play), and Commerce.  
 
Additionally, I am using AI for the purposes of improving advertising: this is so called "computational advertising". I work closely with Product Management to create technology for new and innovative advertising products at Google. 
Before Google, I was a Research Scientist and Project Manager. 
 
Specialties: Large-scale Recommender systems 
User Targeting systems 
Machine Learning for User Data 
Data Mining for Advertising. 
Product Advertising. 
 
Some Products I've worked on:  
Product Search (Now Google Shopping): Related Products, Related Accessories, Shopping Home Page 
Android Market (Now Google Play): Related apps (Users who viewed, Users who installed), Top Lists, Trending Apps 
Google Books: Related Books 
Search Ads: Query rewrites 
Google Offers

Summary I am an adventurer by heart, thinker and researcher by mind, and a social person :) I have a strong research background (PhD), and a strong software development experience (Google software engineer / TL). I know how to simplify and organize things. I am fascinated by technology breakthroughs that deeply affect people’s lives.  
 
I learnt how to own a project: project definition/redefinition, assessing chances of success, setting goals and priorities, architecting solutions, writing design docs, coding, testing, leading a team, interacting within and outside the team (other teams, lawyers, UI/UXers, testers, third-party companies), capable of organizing large amount of knowledge into written documents (design docs, patents, but also multiple papers and a thesis). 
 
I have worked with big data and complex problems: evolutionary algorithms PhD (massive experiments and analysis), Google Search corpus (synonyms, queries, knowledge graph), wrote multiple map-reduces, have machine learning knowledge. 
 
I have strong soft skills: spoke at public events, taught classes (university students, elderly, kids), networked at conferences and local meetings, interviewed ~100 candidates, 
actively organized team/office events, offsites, etc. At ease with presenting. 
 
I’m looking to use my skills in a fast-paced, challenging, entrepreneurial environment where I can be responsible for my decisions, and be creative. Summary Solve challenging and useful problems. The rest should follow. 
 
I have worked on and led large-scale complex projects serving hundreds of thousands of requests per second with latencies measured in low milliseconds as an individual contributor, tech lead and also manager in teams consisting up to 20 people. These projects are all highly technical, requiring deep understanding of subjects such as Bayesian statistics and information retrieval. They range from being "legacy"​ projects where the challenge is to revitalize the project by building and driving a new vision for the team, to "pie-in-the-sky"​ projects where the challenge is to design and implement a solution that delivers a specified product goal. 
 
I operate firmly on the basis of "if you are not evaluating changes, you are not building a product" mentality, and believe in designing and using testing methodologies such as A/B testing to guide quality iterations. Summary Solve challenging and useful problems. The rest should follow.

Experience Sr Software Engineer, Maps for Business (Google Maps Engine and Earth Enterprise) Google November 2013  – Present (1 year 9 months) Mountain View, CA For several months at the start of this period I assisted in the development and support of one of Google's oldest Geo products -- "Earth Enterprise" provides enterprise customers of Google Earth with the ability to generate their own globes from proprietary data. The product is used by government agencies and infrastructure-oriented businesses throughout the world. 
 
I subsequently joined the Google Maps Engine "Core" team. GME is Google's premier enterprise-grade solution for geographic data processing in the cloud. In January 2015 Google announced that GME will be discontinued and the service shut down in January 2016. So for the rest of 2015 I am part of the GME "Sunset Cruise" team. 
 
One of advantage of the "Sunset Cruise" is that we have considerable liberty to look into new areas for the future -- I am currently exploring the development of mobile (Android) applications. Pivotal Systems provides products that solve some of the toughest yield and throughput plasma etch and deposition challenges in high-volume manufacturing. With its revolutionary combination of non-intrusive sensors and proprietary software, Pivotal assures exactly the same optimum process outcome, run after run, lot after lot, regardless of drifts in process or tool parameters. This is accomplished with a suite of in situ, closed-loop control solutions that keep plasma-based etch and deposition processes centered in the process window.
